segment.source: How to Create a Virtual Application Package Using an App-V Package Accelerator
segment.target: How to Create a Virtual Application Package Using an App-V Package Accelerator

segment.source: How to Create a Virtual Application Package Using an App-V Package Accelerator
segment.target: How to Create a Virtual Application Package Using an App-V Package Accelerator

segment.source: How to Create a Virtual Application Package Using an App-V Package Accelerator
segment.target: How to Create a Virtual Application Package Using an App-V Package Accelerator

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The App-V 5.1 Sequencer does not grant any license rights to the software application that you use to create the Package Accelerator.
segment.target: The App-V 5.1 Sequencer does not grant any license rights to the software application that you use to create the Package Accelerator.

segment.source: You must abide by all end user license terms for the application that you use.
segment.target: You must abide by all end user license terms for the application that you use.

segment.source: It is your responsibility to make sure that the software application’s license terms allow you to create a Package Accelerator with the App-V 5.1 Sequencer.
segment.target: It is your responsibility to make sure that the software application’s license terms allow you to create a Package Accelerator with the App-V 5.1 Sequencer.

segment.source: Use the following procedure to create a virtual application package with the App-V 5.1 Package Accelerator.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to create a virtual application package with the App-V 5.1 Package Accelerator.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Before you start this procedure, copy the required Package Accelerator locally to the computer that runs the App-V 5.1 Sequencer.
segment.target: Before you start this procedure, copy the required Package Accelerator locally to the computer that runs the App-V 5.1 Sequencer.

segment.source: You should also copy all required installation files for the package to a local directory on the computer that runs the Sequencer.
segment.target: You should also copy all required installation files for the package to a local directory on the computer that runs the Sequencer.

segment.source: This is the directory that you have to specify in step 5 of this procedure.
segment.target: This is the directory that you have to specify in step 5 of this procedure.

segment.source: To create a virtual application package with an App-V 5.1 Package Accelerator
segment.target: To create a virtual application package with an App-V 5.1 Package Accelerator

segment.source: To start the App-V Sequencer, on the computer that runs the App-V 5.1 Sequencer, click StartAll ProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.
segment.target: To start the App-V Sequencer, on the computer that runs the App-V 5.1 Sequencer, click StartAll ProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.

segment.source: To start the Create New Package Wizard, click Create a New Virtual Application Package.
segment.target: To start the Create New Package Wizard, click Create a New Virtual Application Package.

segment.source: To create the package, select the Create Package using a Package Accelerator check box, and then click Next.
segment.target: To create the package, select the Create Package using a Package Accelerator check box, and then click Next.

segment.source: To specify the package accelerator that will be used to create the new virtual application package, click Browse on the Select Package Accelerator page.
segment.target: To specify the package accelerator that will be used to create the new virtual application package, click Browse on the Select Package Accelerator page.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: If the publisher of the package accelerator cannot be verified and does not contain a valid digital signature, then before you click Run, you must confirm that you trust the source of the package accelerator.
segment.target: If the publisher of the package accelerator cannot be verified and does not contain a valid digital signature, then before you click Run, you must confirm that you trust the source of the package accelerator.

segment.source: Confirm your choice in the Security Warning dialog box.
segment.target: Confirm your choice in the Security Warning dialog box.

segment.source: On the Guidance page, review the publishing guidance information that is displayed in the information pane.
segment.target: On the Guidance page, review the publishing guidance information that is displayed in the information pane.

segment.source: This information was added when the Package Accelerator was created and it contains guidance about how to create and publish the package.
segment.target: This information was added when the Package Accelerator was created and it contains guidance about how to create and publish the package.

segment.source: To export the guidance information to a text (.txt) file, click Export and specify the location where the file should be saved, and then click Next.
segment.target: To export the guidance information to a text (.txt) file, click Export and specify the location where the file should be saved, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Select Installation Files page, click Make New Folder to create a local folder that contains all required installation files for the package, and specify where the folder should be saved.
segment.target: On the Select Installation Files page, click Make New Folder to create a local folder that contains all required installation files for the package, and specify where the folder should be saved.

segment.source: You must also specify a name to be assigned to the folder.
segment.target: You must also specify a name to be assigned to the folder.

segment.source: You must then copy all required installation files to the location that you specified.
segment.target: You must then copy all required installation files to the location that you specified.

segment.source: If the folder that contains the installation files already exists on the computer that runs the Sequencer, click Browse to select the folder.
segment.target: If the folder that contains the installation files already exists on the computer that runs the Sequencer, click Browse to select the folder.

segment.source: Alternatively, if you have already copied the installation files to a directory on this computer, click Make New Folder, browse to the folder that contains the installation files, and then click Next.
segment.target: Alternatively, if you have already copied the installation files to a directory on this computer, click Make New Folder, browse to the folder that contains the installation files, and then click Next.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can specify the following types of supported installation files:
segment.target: You can specify the following types of supported installation files:

segment.source: Windows Installer files (.msi)
segment.target: Windows Installer files (.msi)

segment.source: Cabinet files (.cab)
segment.target: Cabinet files (.cab)

segment.source: Compressed files with a .zip file name extension
segment.target: Compressed files with a .zip file name extension

segment.source: The actual application files
segment.target: The actual application files

segment.source: The following file types are not supported: .msp and .exe files.
segment.target: The following file types are not supported: .msp and .exe files.

segment.source: If you specify an .exe file, you must extract the installation files manually.
segment.target: If you specify an .exe file, you must extract the installation files manually.

segment.source: If the package accelerator requires an application to be installed before you apply the Package Accelerator, and if you have already installed the required application, select I have installed all applications, and then click Next on the Local Installation page.
segment.target: If the package accelerator requires an application to be installed before you apply the Package Accelerator, and if you have already installed the required application, select I have installed all applications, and then click Next on the Local Installation page.

segment.source: On the Package Name page, specify a name that will be associated with the package.
segment.target: On the Package Name page, specify a name that will be associated with the package.

segment.source: The name that you specify identifies the package in the App-V Management Console.
segment.target: The name that you specify identifies the package in the App-V Management Console.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Create Package page, provide comments that will be associated with the package.
segment.target: On the Create Package page, provide comments that will be associated with the package.

segment.source: The comments should contain identifying information about the package that you are creating.
segment.target: The comments should contain identifying information about the package that you are creating.

segment.source: To confirm the location where the package is created, review the information that is displayed in Save Location.
segment.target: To confirm the location where the package is created, review the information that is displayed in Save Location.

segment.source: To compress the package, select Compress Package.
segment.target: To compress the package, select Compress Package.

segment.source: Select the Compress Package check box if the package will be streamed across the network, or when the package size exceeds 4 GB.
segment.target: Select the Compress Package check box if the package will be streamed across the network, or when the package size exceeds 4 GB.

segment.source: To create the package, click Create.
segment.target: To create the package, click Create.

segment.source: After the package is created, click Next.
segment.target: After the package is created, click Next.

segment.source: On the Configure Software page, to enable the Sequencer to configure the applications that are contained in the package, select Configure Software.
segment.target: On the Configure Software page, to enable the Sequencer to configure the applications that are contained in the package, select Configure Software.

segment.source: In this step you can configure any associated tasks that must be completed in order to run the application on the target computers.
segment.target: In this step you can configure any associated tasks that must be completed in order to run the application on the target computers.

segment.source: For example, you can configure any associated license agreements.
segment.target: For example, you can configure any associated license agreements.

segment.source: If you select Configure Software, the following items can be configured using the Sequencer as part of this step:
segment.target: If you select Configure Software, the following items can be configured using the Sequencer as part of this step:

segment.source: Load Package.
segment.target: Load Package.

segment.source: The Sequencer loads the files that are associated with the package.
segment.target: The Sequencer loads the files that are associated with the package.

segment.source: It can take several seconds to an hour to decode the package.
segment.target: It can take several seconds to an hour to decode the package.

segment.source: Run Each Program.
segment.target: Run Each Program.

segment.source: Optionally run the programs that are contained in the package.
segment.target: Optionally run the programs that are contained in the package.

segment.source: This step is helpful to complete any associated license or configuration tasks that are required to run the application before you deploy and run the package on target computers.
segment.target: This step is helpful to complete any associated license or configuration tasks that are required to run the application before you deploy and run the package on target computers.

segment.source: To run all the programs at once, select at least one program, and then click Run All.
segment.target: To run all the programs at once, select at least one program, and then click Run All.

segment.source: To run specific programs, select the program or programs that you want to run, and then click Run Selected.
segment.target: To run specific programs, select the program or programs that you want to run, and then click Run Selected.

segment.source: Complete the required configuration tasks, and then close the applications.
segment.target: Complete the required configuration tasks, and then close the applications.

segment.source: It can take several minutes for all programs to run.
segment.target: It can take several minutes for all programs to run.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: Save Package.
segment.target: Save Package.

segment.source: The Sequencer saves the package.
segment.target: The Sequencer saves the package.

segment.source: Primary Feature Block.
segment.target: Primary Feature Block.

segment.source: The Sequencer optimizes the package for streaming by rebuilding the primary feature block.
segment.target: The Sequencer optimizes the package for streaming by rebuilding the primary feature block.

segment.source: If you do not want to configure the applications, click Skip this step, and to go to step 9 of this procedure, and then click Next.
segment.target: If you do not want to configure the applications, click Skip this step, and to go to step 9 of this procedure, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Completion page, after you review the information that is displayed in the Virtual Application Package Report pane, click Close.
segment.target: On the Completion page, after you review the information that is displayed in the Virtual Application Package Report pane, click Close.

segment.source: The package is now available in the Sequencer.
segment.target: The package is now available in the Sequencer.

segment.source: To edit the package properties, click Edit Package Name.
segment.target: To edit the package properties, click Edit Package Name.

segment.source: For more information about how to modify a package, see How to Modify an Existing Virtual Application Package.
segment.target: For more information about how to modify a package, see How to Modify an Existing Virtual Application Package.

segment.source: Got a suggestion for App-V?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for App-V?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: Got an App-V issue?
segment.target: Got an App-V issue?

segment.source: Use the App-V TechNet Forum.
segment.target: Use the App-V TechNet Forum.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Operations for App-V 5.1
